1265621613845909504.text: (8/8) We all must work together and continue to move forward with a thoughtful and effective approach to combating the #coronavirus that takes into account the challenges facing all Americans, including those in need of mental health services.

1265621613107609601.text: (7/8) My visit on Tuesday was just the start of our efforts to ensure needed mental health services are reaching those who need them the most during this #public #health #crisis.

1265621612415639552.text: (6/8) Additionally, @RepCindyAxne (D-IA), @RepBalderson (R-OH), and I introduced H.R. 6654, the Emergency COVID-19 Telehealth Response Act, to make sure that clinical social #workers can be #reimbursed for providing their #therapy services via telehealth.

1265621611664850946.text: (5/8) #Congress has taken steps to address the mental health challenges posed by COVID-19. On March 27, 2020, with my support, Congress passed the CARES Act, which included $425 million for @samhsagov and loosened restrictions on the use of telehealth in #Medicare.

1265621610977005573.text: (4/8) I heard from Dr. Buster Lackey, a licensed professional counselor and the executive director of @NAMIArkansas about the barriers he is seeing to treating patents during this time, particularly with regard to #telehealth.

1265621610276491265.text: (3/8) Last Tuesday, I had the pleasure of speaking with Arkansas #mental #health providers and advocates about what they are witnessing and experiencing and about potential #solutions.

1265621609559330817.text: (2/8) Staying at home can bring intense feelings of #loneliness and exacerbate mental health issues. In addition, the economic repercussions of #COVID19 can bring about feelings of #hopelessness. Tragically, increased anxiety has increased the rates of #suicide in past crises.

1265621608883990528.text: (1/8) Many of us are practicing social distancing as a way to protect ourselves and our families from #COVID19. The space we put between ourselves and our neighbors may be protecting us physically, but as a result mental health across #Arkansas and the nation has suffered.

1265473049371062273.text: (2/2) With his extensive background and experience in infectious diseases, Dr. Jose Romero is a fine choice to replace Dr. Smith. I respect his work and leadership at @ADHPIO and he will serve the state well as Interim Secretary of Health.

1265473048779595776.text: (1/2) Dr. Nate Smith has been an invaluable asset to the people of Arkansas. His selection to serve at @CDCgov affirms what we already knew here at home: his expertise and guidance will save lives during this pandemic.
